newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares end firm, FCL Paper, Forests well-sought.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares end firm, FCL Paper, Forests well-sought.

text.p: New Zealand's leading share prices ended modestly firmer on Monday thanks mostly to strength in the domestic bond market, brokers said.
But the slight gain of 4.53 points to 2,370.82 was again on healthy turnover, which was high for a Monday at NZ$51.7 million.
Fletcher Paper rose two to NZ$3.40 and Fletcher Forests closed up four at $1.99.
FCL Paper, Forests and Telecom were actively traded and Murray Rutherford at SBC Warburg said it was a leader's market.

Chemicals group Fernz Corp took a step back, despite favourable publicity over the weekend about its latest initiative in France. By the close Fernz had lost nine cents to NZ$4.95, though on light turnover.
Energy stocks performed strongly, among them being TransAlta up 10 at NZ$2.00, Bay of Plenty Electricity, up five at $6.90 and Enerco, up five at $5.70.
Rutherford said the sector had run well in response to the expectation that further rationalisation, particularly in electricity, would take place.
"A lot of these companies will benefit from further rationalisation and I'm sure it will happen over time," he said.
